tweet: This week the House passed a sweeping package to protect our elections from foreign interference. Make no mistake, the Russian campaign to undermine our democracy is far from over. The president won’t take the threat seriously—so the Democratic House took action.

The brave men and women of our Coast Guard serve our country tirelessly—even when the Trump Shutdown left them without pay for over a month. We must do our duty to support them. I’m proud to cosponsor the Pay our Coast Guard Parity Act, which passed out of committee today!

We owe a profound debt to the millions who marched, spoke out and struggled for decades to achieve equality, security ,and respect. Now is the time to finish the job. The Senate must pass the Equality Act once and for all! 2/2

Four years ago, today, marriage equality became the law of the land. Six years ago, the defense of marriage act was struck down. Sixteen years ago, same sex couples were decriminalized nationwide. The progress we have made was hard-won, but astounding. 1/2

The House voted this week to repeal the 2001 AUMF—used for years to justify endless wars and interventions without Congress. I’ve supported this critical reform for years. We’re standing up for the Constitution and restoring common sense to our foreign policy.

The 2001 Authorization for the Use of Military Force has been used to justify military action around the world for almost 2 decades, undermining Congress’s constitutional power to govern our foreign policy. It must be repealed.

Seven years ago today, DREAMers gained the freedom to live and work here in the U.S. They enrich and strengthen our communities. They know no country but ours. The president's decision to cancel DACA was outrageous, and we’ll keep fighting for them. The Senate must pass HR 6 now!

Government should work for every American. H.R.1 includes sweeping election security measures, fights against dark money, and works to end gerrymandering once and for all. It also takes on corruption and holds special interests accountable. The Senate must pass it now!
Climate change will impact every aspect of our lives. Our economy, our national security, the food we eat, our environment—the list is endless. We need to invest now. Every delay is costly.
